Articles.Content: where is the MM .cfg to get the merlins to attach to the tower?

1 hour ago, DarthVader said:

where is the MM .cfg to get the merlins to attach to the tower?

The only MM config adds the attachment node to the Octaweb. I decided it was easier to attach to the octoweb on he 1.1 and 1.1FT. On the F1 and the F9 1.0, the Merlin 1C already has an attachment node, so no MM patch is needed.

Anyway, the MM patch for the Octaweb is located here: GameData/Science818/configs
after actually reading the readme.txt, I figured it out, thanks! now to make a strongback for a 5 core FH?

I've actually thought about that, but that presents numerous real world problems... As a result, I can't think of any configuration of a tower that would work. I could just throw something together, but it wouldn't look right... It's for that reason that I've tried to base my towers off of what already exists..

Hey @sciencepanda maybe I have a solution for some small glitches with the launch towers. Maybe you should just remove the LaunchClamp module from all the towers configs. This will prevent things like towers floating around in the air (see KottabosGames video) and probably also the bug where the Falcon Heavy launch tower falls to one side. You could use ModuleAnimatedDecoupler to play the decoupling animation (the retract of the launchclamps) when the rocket/tower is seperated. Maybe you want to give it a try. Otherwise, very neat work.

Here's the review from KottabosGames

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wxssqhdElgM

3 hours ago, Kartoffelkuchen said:

Hey @sciencepanda maybe I have a solution for some small glitches with the launch towers. Maybe you should just remove the LaunchClamp module from all the towers configs. This will prevent things like towers floating around in the air (see KottabosGames video) and probably also the bug where the Falcon Heavy launch tower falls to one side. You could use ModuleAnimatedDecoupler to play the decoupling animation (the retract of the launchclamps) when the rocket/tower is seperated. Maybe you want to give it a try. Otherwise, very neat work.

A few things I probably should have addressed in the Op....

Floating in the air: I meant to do that, it kinda provides a more stable launch pad.

The tower falling down: It's meant to retract to the ground upon liftoff: however, if you place the tower as your first part, it will glitch and cause the tower to jump to the end of the "launch" animation upon completion of the "retract animation"... So, you should place the launch tower last. I'll update the OP to make sure that is mentioned.

So are these towers made with RO/RSS sizes in mind? I don't know much about Laztek's packs, I used them one time and the rocket didn't work very well (back in .25 or so) and the memory it took up wasn't worth it for me, and I don't think I ever used it without RSS involved so I don't remember if the rockets were kerbalized and then patched to fit RSS sizes. I have been looking for more launch towers (even made a mod request about it a few months back) and I'd definitely like to add this to my RO/RP-0 build. If not I can always make a config in tweakscale.

2 hours ago, shoe7ess said:

So are these towers made with RO/RSS sizes in mind? I don't know much about Laztek's packs, I used them one time and the rocket didn't work very well (back in .25 or so) and the memory it took up wasn't worth it for me, and I don't think I ever used it without RSS involved so I don't remember if the rockets were kerbalized and then patched to fit RSS sizes. I have been looking for more launch towers (even made a mod request about it a few months back) and I'd definitely like to add this to my RO/RP-0 build. If not I can always make a config in tweakscale.

All of Kartoffelkuchens launch vehicles are 1:1 scale with their real world counterparts, and these launch towers are made more or less specifically for Launchers Pack: SpaceX LVP, so yes, they are made with RSSRO in mind. I believe there are configs contained within this mod that does rescale the launch vehicles, but that only scales the down in size.

Is it possible to make the pipe/ tube things that stay connected to the f9 even after strong back retraction?

Edited January 15, 2016 by Drj3199

I wondered about that too actually. Yes, it's possible, if I may answer for sciencepanda. He can then animate the end of the pipe that it stays visually attached to the Falcon 9/Heavy while strongback retracts and make another animation which let's him deploy the tubes. 

Though if he wants to do it, that's his thing.
